pageContext.quote: Tranquility can't be grasped except by those who have reached an unwavering and firm power of judgment — the rest constantly fall and rise in their decisions, wavering in a state of alternately rejecting and accepting things. What is the cause of this back and forth? It's because nothing is clear and they rely on the most uncertain guide — common opinion.
pageContext.platform: Moral Letters, 95.57b-58a via The Daily Stoic
